import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the "../input/" directory.
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))
df = pd.read_csv('/kaggle/input/haberman/haberman.csv')



#print(df1)

source.c022b1f3:
#2-D Scatter Plot
#Graph to Plot Between Age and Operation Year and Check whether the person Survived or not


sns.set_style('whitegrid')
sns.FacetGrid(df,hue = 'status', size=10) \
    .map(plt.scatter,'age','operation_year' ) \
    .add_legend();
plt.title('AGE v/s OPERATION YEAR ', COLOR = 'red' , size=20)
plt.show()
source.bced8a5c:
#2-D Scatter Plot
#Graph to Plot Between Age and Axil_Nodes and Check whether the person Survived or not
sns.set_style('whitegrid')
sns.FacetGrid(df,hue = 'status', size=10) \
    .map(plt.scatter,'age','axil_nodes' ) \
    .add_legend();
plt.title('AGE v/s AXIL_NODES ', COLOR = 'green' , size=20)
plt.show()

source.86b9a620:
sns.set_style('whitegrid')
sns.FacetGrid(df,hue = 'status', size=10) \
    .map(sns.distplot, 'axil_nodes' ) \
    .add_legend();
plt.title('Probability Density Function (PDF) ', COLOR = 'red' , size=20)
plt.show()
source.8ef00d73:
#Dividing th dataset According to Survivality

sur = df.loc[df['status']==1];
d_sur = df.loc[df['status']==2];

counts1,bin_edges = np.histogram(sur['axil_nodes'], bins = 10, density = True)
counts2,bin_edges = np.histogram(d_sur['axil_nodes'], bins = 10, density = True)
pdf1 = counts1/(sum(counts1))
pdf2 =  counts2/(sum(counts2))
#print(pdf)
cdf1 = np.cumsum(pdf1)
cdf2 = np.cumsum(pdf2)

#plt.plot(bin_edges[1:],pdf)
plt.title('CDF of axil_Nodes for Survival')
plt.plot(bin_edges[1:], cdf1, color = 'blue', label = 'Survived')
plt.plot(bin_edges[1:], cdf2, color = 'red', label = 'Did Not Survive')
plt.title('Cumulitive Density Function (CDF) ', COLOR = 'red' , size=20)
plt.xlabel('age')
plt.ylabel('%age of People')
plt.legend()
plt.show()

plt.title('Box Plot', size =15, color = 'green')
plt.show()

sns.violinplot(x ='status', y = 'axil_nodes', data = df, size = 10)
plt.title('Violin Plot', size =15, color = 'green')
plt.show()
source.7c4828de:
**Conclusions And Assumptions:**
* People between the age group of 30-40 years hava a higher survival rate.
* People in the age group of 40-60 have the higher rate of being affected by the disease.
* People with lower axil-nodes have( <10) slightly better chances of survival.

* The dataset has 306 observations and 4 columns
* 225 patiens survived for more than 5 years ater operation  out of 306 patiens

source.093a4804:
**Final Conclusions**
* People with leeser number of axil nodes have higher survival rate
* People who had operation in their younger age had higher survival rate
